text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Administration board of troubled Banca Dacia Felix SA private bank accepted bid from British consortium wishing to acquire shares worth $45 million in the bank.
ADEVARUL
- Price of fuel wood doubled to some 63,000 lei per tonne and reserves have already run out.
- State airline Tarom SA plans to buy eight Boeing aircraft in next two years as part of its restructuring plans.
- Bill on privatisation of commercial banks will be delayed as it has to go through parliament commission to harmonise text passed by upper Senate and by lower Chamber of Deputies.
AZI
- Communications Ministry expects to announce successful bidders for GSM licence after Oct 25.
LIBERTATEA
- SNCFR national rail company will auction off 25,000 tonnes of scrap iron on Oct 11. Minimum accepted bid is $95 per tonne.
- Over-the-counter market was officialy launched on Friday. It will start actual trading after one month of tests.
- Asirom SA insurer plans to raise motor car premiums.
CRONICA ROMANA
- Romanian truck maker Roman SA plans joint venture with U.S. company Navi Star to manufacture truck engines.
General:
Major newspapers, except ROMANIA LIBERA, report on the death of Nicu Ceausescu, youngest son of late dictator Nicolae Ceausescu.
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Four-page "state of the nation" report.
- Newspaper reports on so-called monarchist rally outside National Peasant Party on Friday.
- On October 1 students will start new academic year, but most of student hostels have no sanitary conditions.
ADEVARUL
- Pseudo-monarchist meeting in Bucharest was "transparent" provocation.
- War on copyright regarding "piglet" label for local detergents continues. One of two companies refuses to give up.
- Romanian Orthodox Church will ask new parliament to make study of religion compulsory in schools.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- Opposition National Peasant Party accused ruling party of being behind monarchist rally.
CURIERUL NATIONAL
- Romania and U.S. are Hungary's closest military partners.
- Romanian military fleet has two new ships.
- Romanian-Hungary treaty is praised in U.S. Chamber of Representatives.
CRONICA ROMANA
- American congressmen submitted favourable resolution regarding Romania in U.S. Congress.
- Newspaper report story in German newspaper Die Welt saying Romania might be included among five countries in first wave of admissions to NATO.
JURNALUL NATIONAL
- Newspaer quotes parliamentary report on involvement of Hungarian intelligence in Romania's December 1989 revolution.
COTIDIANUL
- Adrian Nastase, ruling PDSR party executive president, denied existence of offer from opposition Democratic Convention bloc regarding possible post-electoral ruling coalition.
ZIUA
- Fate of Romanian-Ukrainian treaty to be decided next year.
- Ruling Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) and state television set up monarchist diversion against Democratic Convention. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
